Exercise: Using preferences in a handler and in a part [[tutorial_preferences_application_target"> === Target
In this exercise you modify the handler within the application to enter the user and listen to changes in the corresponding preference values in a part.
We do not persists the password in this exercises, because persisting passwords without encryption is a security risk.
[[tutorial_preferencesstorage"> === Using preferences in your handler
Extend your EnterCredentialsHandler handler to get and store the user via the preference values. As nodePath is not explicitly set for the @Execugte method, it uses _com.example.e4.rcp.todo_, which is the Bundle-SymbolicName of your application plug-in.
The @Preference annotation is not yet released as official API. See
.
For test purpose listen to preference changes in your playground view and print the values to the console.
[[tutorial_preferences_validate"> === Validating the implementation
Start your application. Use the menu entry which uses the EnterCredentialsHandler handler and enter a user into the dialog. Close the dialog and open it again via the menu. The last entered user should be displayed.
